title.narrative: 05-04 QUALITY AND LEARNING OUTCOMES

description.narrative: By 2017, in 19 prefectures and in the peri-urban area of Conakry, Dubreka and Coyah, innovations and gender sensitive teaching methods and focused on learners are effectively implemented, gradually scaled up with special focus on the qualification of teachers, availability of teaching materials and participation of girls and boys, and improve to 10 points the successfullness of student learnings, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, 15% of preschool children have access to quality early childhood education 70% of school-age children are enrolled in primary school and at least 40% of 12 years children complete a full cycle of primary school parity between boys and girls is realized for related indicators

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, in 19 prefectures and in the peri-urban area of Conakry, Dubreka and Coyah, innovations and gender sensitive teachingmethods and focused on learners are effectively implemented, gradually scaled up with special focus on the qualification ofteachers, availability of teaching materials and participation of girls and boys, and improve to 10 points the successfullness ofstudent learnings

description.narrative: In parallel with pilot still on going in 479 primary schools, a roadmap to scale-up active teaching methods has been elaborated. 54 primary schools&39; principals has been trained in partnership with 2 Canadian Universities on pedagogical and administrative leadership. Quality need to be addressed more holistically in the next ESP. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:13/12/2017

title.narrative: % of schools implementing teaching innovations in targeted prefectures

actual.value: 2016:74.6 %: 1262 schools out of 1691 schools from the targeted prefectures are implementing at least one the two following innovations : active pedagogies and school scorecard.
